definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: I was looking at her face, she really can carry heavy make-up even with smoky eyes.
sentences.chinese: 看著她一張可肩起濃妝的臉，煙燻眼也很適合她呢。

definition: to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
(coll.) back (of a human or other vertebrate)
carrying pole and the loads on it/burden/task/responsibility/CL:副[fu4]
heavy load/heavy burden (also fig. of tax)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
with callouses on hands and feet (idiom)/to work one's fingers to the bone
lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
to save from extinction/to save the nation
